TopicTitle: Why am I earning so much science?!

Articles.Content:
I noticed for even doing really easy mission like test a mainsail over Kerbin I get close to 800 science and for just accepting the mission I got 2000! Why is this?

In the phots you will see the mods i am using, the tasks i have in the new administration building, and the results from a very simple mission. I personally think its a combo of the new admin building and the fine print mod not being balanced to the new admin stuff. I don't know any ideas will help.

Edited October 21, 2014 by sp1989
Balancing career and contracts/strategies will be focussed on in further updates, just getting them in the game was he focus of previous updates

Balancing career and contracts/strategies will be focussed on in further updates, just getting them in the game was he focus of previous updates

So getting obscene amounts of science is just a glitch/benefit of the .25 update?

Same thing here. Mission tells me like +30 science but my total goes up by a few hundred. I've almost got whole tree unlocked after only a few missions.

I do have a science focus admin selected but it still seems like I'm getting way too much.

Read the print on the strategies. It says you get X science points per Y funds, or Z rep. Then look at the contract and see how much funds or rep you'd get. Do that math and you'll see why you get so much science.
Yep it's mostly an effect of outsourced R&D that disturbes the balance. If you deactivate that it gets better. I'm pretty sure this is getting adressed "soon". My bet is early beta
